author: Chris Greenberg
title: ESPN trolls Patriots fans on Twitter (and Bill Simmons trolls right back) - Patriots
text:
Patriots fans may feel like their team is facing two rivals on Sunday: The Colts and ESPN .
The sports media monolith, whose coverage of Deflategate became a part of the ongoing scandal on multiple occassions , tweeted an image of deflated footballs from its NFL Twitter account ahead of the Patriots’ highly anticipated matchup against the Colts on Sunday night.
It's NFL Sunday Week 6. GET PUMPED UP. (AP/Rick Osentoski) pic.twitter.com/lwfPh77jW9
— NFL on ESPN (@ESPNNFL) October 18, 2015 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Former ESPN employee and notable Boston sports fan Bill Simmons then trolled ESPN for its reference to Deflategate:
"WE REPORTED THIS STORY WRONG HA HA" RT @ESPNNFL : It's NFL Sunday Week 6. GET PUMPED UP. (AP/Rick Osentoski) pic.twitter.com/NmqWcXGtb0
— Bill Simmons (@BillSimmons) October 18, 2015 Casting Deflategate: The Movie
